properties.Name: Tussoa
properties.Info: Once a humble fishing village, Tussoa has blossomed into a respectable city but still boasts a relaxed way of life.

properties.Name: Port Damali
properties.Info: As the unofficial capital of free trade outside the empire, Port Damali is a colorful confluence of cultures. Trade routes splinter from all sides of the city to ensure rapid transport of goods throughout Wildemount and beyond.

properties.Name: Palma Flora
properties.Info: A vacation destination for merchants from nearby ports, Palma Flora is famous for its annual shark hunting tournament.

properties.Name: Gwardan
properties.Info: Known for its sprawling mines of precious metals and stones, Gwardan is a cultural center for elves. The city is renowned for its smiths that use a unique style of metalworking called "steamcasting."

properties.Name: Vol'antim
properties.Info: The hidden cliffside sttlement of Vol'antim is nestled deep within the heart of the Cyrios Mountains. The community is home to aarakocra who live in relative seclusion.

properties.Name: Pride's Call
properties.Info: Within the rolling hills of the Zemni Fields, the city of Pride's Call became the center of hilldwarf culture in Wildemount after the Calamity.

properties.Name: Kamordah
properties.Info: Kamordah was built within the Bromkiln Hills by a collection of zealous followers of Desirat the Twilight Pheonix. Now the city boasts a carefully guarded industry for farming exotic herbs and fauna, made possible by geothermal activity.

properties.Name: Deastok
properties.Info: The sister city of Kamordah, Deastok is appears unusually affluent for its size due to the presence of the Truscan family.

properties.Name: Felderwin
properties.Info: As the heart of halfling society in Wynandir, Felderwin is surrounded by fertile farmland that has been cultivated by the halfling community for over seven centuries.

properties.Name: Grimgolir
properties.Info: The dwarven stronghold of Grimgolir sits at the core of an immense network of tunnels carved throughout the southern Dunrock Mountains. The tribulations of the city have shaped the ideology to which its dwarven citizens cling: to succeed is to struggle.

properties.Name: Hupperdook
properties.Info: The smoke-stacked city of Hupperdook is the heart of industry in the empire, manufacturing technological marvels and large-scale weapons of war for the Dwendalian Empire.

properties.Name: Bladegarden
properties.Info: Acting as both a training complex for the Righteous Brand and the core of orcish society in Western Wynandir, Bladegarden is a large military complex whose denizens are filled with a sense of honor and pride.

properties.Name: Ashguard Garrison
properties.Info: A partner stronghold to the northern Rockguard Garrison, the Ashguard Garrison sits atop a steep mountain pass on the south side of the Brokenveil Bluffs.

properties.Name: Rockguard Garrison
properties.Info: The Rockguard Garrison was constructed in a joint effort between the Crown and Grimgolir as a symbol of politcal union. The fortress has held strong for generations without being breached.

properties.Name: Urzin
properties.Info: A uniquely mobile settlement with its permanent dwellings built on the backs of dozens of horizonback tortoises, Urzin is home to swamp hunters, scouts, and trappers that know the Brokenveil Marsh like no one else.

properties.Name: Jigow
properties.Info: By negotiations sparked by the Kryn Dynasty, the coastal city of Jigow was formed from competing orc and goblin clans. It rose to become an important source for fishing commerce for the dynasty.

properties.Name: Bazzoxan
properties.Info: Bazzoxan is perpetually locked in a stalemate between the Kryn Dynasty forces and the abyssal incursion from within the ruins of a temple to the Betrayer Gods.

properties.Name: New Haxon
properties.Info: The stalwart outpost of New Haxon is garrisoned by agents of the Cerberus Assembly, along with a contingent of allied mercenaries from nearby Draconia.

properties.Name: Rotthold
properties.Info: The lawless harbor city of Rotthold has no official governing body. Many outlanders view the crime-ridden settlement as little more than a collection of degenerate slums.

properties.Name: Igrathad
properties.Info: Once a battleground where regional factions feuded and warred over resources and glory, the Many Hosts of Igrathad is a scattered network of seven villages with robust communities of goblinkin, orcs and giants.

properties.Name: Charis
properties.Info: The hidden hamlet of Charis was founded by an unlikely alliance between halflings and dragonborn. The village takes no value in gold or jewels, but instead, emphasize community and share equally.

properties.Name: Xarzith Kitril
properties.Info: Built shortly after the fall of Draconia, the fortified stone city of Xarzith Kitril continues to grow in population and industry.

properties.Name: Trostenwald
properties.Info: On the banks of the Ustaloch, the city of Trostenwald thrives on its booming brewing economy. The major brewing families hold a lot of power and are constantly competing with one another.

properties.Name: Alfield
properties.Info: Supplemented by mines in the nearby hills, the small town of Alfield is often regarded as a stop on the route to more important business elsewhere.

properties.Name: Zadash
properties.Info: Once the capital of the Julous Dominion, Zadash sits at the central crossroads of the southern region of the empire. The city is a bastion of law, civilization, and military might in the Marrow Valley.

properties.Name: Berleben
properties.Info: The marsh town of Berleben is nestled deep in the Labenda Swamp. Once promising economic boom in cultivated herbs, the town has floundered due to the instability of the marsh.

properties.Name: Druvenlode
properties.Info: Established in the early years following the Calamity, Druvenlode is the primary source of precious metal in Western Wynandir.

properties.Name: Rexxentrum
properties.Info: Rexxentrum is the majestic capital of the Dwendalian Empire and the largest city in Wildemount. It is the cultural and military center of Western Wynandir.

properties.Name: Odessloe
properties.Info: Adjacent to the clear waters of the Erdeloch, Odessloe is a prominent fishing and logging town, supplying Rexxentrum and the surrounding townships with fresh fish and lumber.

properties.Name: Nogvurot
properties.Info: A major stop along the Glory Run Road heading eastward from the capital, Nogvurot hosts travelers making their way through the empire.

properties.Name: Shadycreek Run
properties.Info: Originally comprised of a patchwork of makeshift, impoverished societies run by cruel slumlords, Shadycreek Run is now known as a hive of criminal activity and savage humanity given free reign.

properties.Name: Boroftkrah
properties.Info: The residents of the remote settlement of Boroftkrah value deeds done in service to the Boroftkrah orc clan. A council of elder warriors governs the town.

properties.Name: Palebank Village
properties.Info: Along the cold shore of the Frigid Depths, Palebank Village marks the first surviving Uthodurn outpost beyond the mountains.

properties.Name: Allowak's Sanctuary
properties.Info: Oops, all Yetis.

properties.Name: Balenpost
properties.Info: The inhabitants of Balenpost are dedicated to planning and executing expeditions to uncover Aeorian items on the island.

properties.Name: Syrinlya
properties.Info: Syrinlya is a collection of yurts filled with mercenary explorers from Uthodurn looking to get rich.

properties.Name: Uthodurn
properties.Info: Hidden among the icy peaks of the Flotket Alps, the dwarven stronghold of Uthodurn is a bastion of dwarven culture. The hardy folks of the city have endured the freezing temperatures and continuous snowfall for centuries.

properties.Name: Bysaes Tyl
properties.Info: The rustic elven city of Bysaes Tyl is built synergistically within the tangled boreal forests.

properties.Name: Icehaven
properties.Info: Icehaven is home to the dozen or so ships in the region outfitted to wander the ice floes of the Frigid Depths. The city is a central trading post for hunters and adventurers who brave the Saltwallow Bog or the frozen north toward Eiselcross.

properties.Name: Yrrosa
properties.Info: Comprised of huble homesteads and numerous inns, the town of Yrrosa is a comfortable stop among the surrounding frigid fields.

properties.Name: Blumenthal
properties.Info: A sprawling collection of rural farmsteads connected by administration buildings, Blumenthal is Rexxentrum's main source of produce and meat.

properties.Name: Othe
properties.Info: Othe is the smallest of the coastal Clovis Concord domains. Often left to their own devices, the denizens of Othe are quite reserved and are less hospitable to outsiders who don't go out of their way to engage with the locals.

properties.Name: Feolinn
properties.Info: Commonly referred to as the Garden City for its rural aesthetic, Feolinn acts as a harbor for the plentiful fishing around the Mother's Sigh Reef.

properties.Name: Port Zoon
properties.Info: Port Zoon is the industrial center of the Clovis Concord. What the city lacks in liveliness and splendor, it makes up for in manufacturing and cutting-edge science.

properties.Name: Nicodranas
properties.Info: The easternmost city of the Menagerie Coast, Nicodranas acts as an embassy state between the Clovis Concord and Dwendalian Empire.

properties.Name: Brokenbank
properties.Info: Despite its important role in the business of the coast, Brokenback lacks the strong cultural identity of the mainland city-states. The settlement is not recognized as an official city by the concord.

properties.Name: Darktow
properties.Info: The eerie, fog-shrouded town of Darktow was originally established as a sanctuary for sailors traveling to Wildemount from Marquet or Tal'Dorei. The town is now the center of piracy in the Lucidian Ocean.

properties.Name: Talonstadt
properties.Info: Home to refugees of the ravenite resistance, the settlement of Talonstadt is not viewed favorably in the eyes of the Crown. Crime, monsters, and the residents themselves trouble the community in this shantytown.

properties.Name: Asarius
properties.Info: Known as the City of Beasts, Asarius is a cluttered sprawl of roughshod homesteads, mud huts, and military fortifications. The city is a cultural hub for the wilder folk of the Kryn Dynasty.

properties.Name: Rosohna
properties.Info: Built on the remains of Ghor Dranas, Rosohna is the center of the powerful Kryn society. A network of caves and tunnels make up an unseen level of the city beneath the surface.

properties.Name: Tomb of the Worm
properties.Info: A clan of wildfolk found the exposed body of Quajath the Undermaw poking through the wall of an icy cave. The people consumed the exposed meat and found that it regrew. They invite others to partake and are fully under the sway of the Undermaw.

properties.Name: Vurmas
properties.Info: The floating outpost of Vurmas is made of three sailing ships tied together and is governed by the Kryn Dynasty. The settlement is kept secret and was established to make allies of Eiselcross's wildfolk.

properties.Name: Whitestone
properties.Info: Founded by the de Rolo family, the city of Whitestone gets its name from the miraculous mineral that is the city's chief export.

properties.Name: Lyrengorn
properties.Info:
Meaning "mountain city" in elvish, Lyrengorn is the last bastion of safety before the endless
ice of the Neverfields to the north.

properties.Name: Terrah
properties.Info: Sheltered within a cauldron-like valley miles deep into the northern mountain range, the village of Terrah is home to the Ashari people that watch over the rift to the Elemental Plane of Earth.

properties.Name: Kraghammer
properties.Info:
Heralded as the true living center of dwarven culture
on the continent, the stronghold of Kraghammer is an autonomous city-state built upon rich veins of platinum and mithral.

properties.Name: Jorenn Village
properties.Info: Silver veins in the nearby rocky hills caused a population boom for the once tiny pioneer town of Jorenn Village.

properties.Name: Westruun
properties.Info:
The city of Westruun is the center of Tal’Dorei, a
crossroads of culture along the Silvercut Roadway that
welcomes adventurers, traders, and vagabonds of all
kinds.

properties.Name: Turst Fields
properties.Info: The small farming community of Turst Fields is a hot spot for trade caravans, as it is one of the main sources for food and produce in all of Tal'Dorei.

properties.Name: Drynna
properties.Info: Thriving on bountiful wildlife around Mooren Lake, the town of Drynna is responsible for most of the freshwater fish supply in eastern Tal'Dorei.

properties.Name: Zephrah
properties.Info: At the top of one of a mountain in the Summit Peaks, Zephrah is the tribal home of the Air Ashari people who keep watch over a gate into the Elemental Plane of Air.

properties.Name: Stilben
properties.Info: Known as the "Rotted Lot" by passing sailors and merchants, Stilben is the largest port city on the eastern coast of Tal'Dorei and is the focal point for all trade to the East.

properties.Name: Kymal
properties.Info:
The city of Kymal stands as the grumbling ghost of a
gold rush mining center now become a haven for gamblers
and criminals.

properties.Name: Emon
properties.Info: Emon is the cultural heart of human civilization on Tal'Dorei and is the nexus of politics, justice, business, industry, and education within the realm.

properties.Name: Emerald Outpost
properties.Info:
Originally established by the elves of Syngorn as a
hidden outpost to keep watch over the growing empire
of Drassig, the Emerald Outpost now stands as a trade post between Emon and Syngorn.

properties.Name: Syngorn
properties.Info:
Founded by the sorceress Yenlara in the wake of the
Divergence, Syngorn marked the first major point of elven
civilization on Tal’Dorei following its calamitous destruction.

properties.Name: Bronbog
properties.Info: A shadow of a greater time, Bronbog is now only recognized for its access to the rare swamp fungus, queenscap.

properties.Name: Hdar-Fye
properties.Info: Hdar-Fye is the necropolis of Princ Hdar and swears fealty to the Iron Emperor in Tz'Arrm as a entity underneath the Iron Authority.

properties.Name: Ezordam-Haar
properties.Info: Known as the eyrie of the red pegasi

properties.Name: Tz'Arrm
properties.Info: Ruled by the Iron Emperor, the hobgoblin city of Tz'Arrm is meticulously ordered and hellishly hot.

properties.Name: Rybad-Kol
properties.Info: Rybad-Kol, the city of the Forge Lords, is a hobgoblin city under the rule of the Iron Authority.

properties.Name: Ortem-Vellak
properties.Info: Inside the trunk of a petrified elven tree, the city of Ortem-Vellak is governed under the mighty hobgoblin empire, the Iron Authority.

properties.Name: Byroden
properties.Info: The northernmost, and second-largest community in the Mornset Countryside, Byroden borders the Gladepools and marks the first stop for any traveler endeavoring to traverse the Rifenmist.

properties.Name: O'Noa
properties.Info: Devastated by the Scattered War, O'Noa was once a great colony for the first human visitors of Tal'Dorei. A small community of criminals, addicts, and opportunists have settled in the derelict city of what is now called New O'Noa.
Founded as the capital of the Qoniira Tetrarchy long before the Calamity, the city of Niirdal-Poc lies hidden in the depths of the Rifenmist Jungle.
properties.Name: Niirdal-Poc
